fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper

Class DataCodingSchemeBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper.DataCodingSchemeBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<DataCodingProvider>, Parent<CloudhopperBuilder>

    public class DataCodingSchemeBuilder
extends AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
implements Builder<DataCodingProvider>
    Data Coding Scheme is a one-octet field in Short Messages (SM) and Cell Broadcast Messages (CB) which carries a basic information how the recipient handset should process the received message. The information includes:
    • the character set or message coding which determines the encoding of the message user data
    • the message class which determines to which component of the Mobile Station (MS) or User Equipment (UE) should be the message delivered
    • the request to automatically delete the message after reading
    • the state of flags indicating presence of unread voicemail, fax, e-mail or other messages
    • the indication that the message content is compressed
    • the language of the cell broadcast message
    The field is described in 3GPP 23.040 and 3GPP 23.038 under the name TP-DCS (see SMS Data Coding Scheme).

    Configures how Cloudhopper determines the Data Coding Scheme to use:

    • Automatic mode:
      • If SMPP v3.3 is used then CharsetMapToGeneralGroupDataCodingProvider generates a DataCoding with DataCoding.createGeneralGroup(byte, Byte, boolean)
      • If SMPP v3.4+ is used then CharsetMapToCharacterEncodingGroupDataCodingProvider generates a DataCoding with DataCoding.createCharacterEncodingGroup(byte)
    • Allow registration of custom DataCodingProvider
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      • DataCodingSchemeBuilder

        public DataCodingSchemeBuilder(CloudhopperBuilder parent,
                               EnvironmentBuilder<?> environmentBuilder,
                               Function<PropertyResolver,Byte> interfaceVersionProvider)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        environmentBuilder - the configuration for property resolution and evaluation
        interfaceVersionProvider - A function used to retrieve the value of the interface version. This is needed when auto(String...) mode is enabled.

    • Method Detail

      • auto

        public DataCodingSchemeBuilder auto(String... enable)
        Enable/disable automatic mode based on SMPP interface version.

        DataCodingProvider implementation is selected based on SMPP interface version. SMPP v3.3 Data Coding Scheme values are defined in SMS Data Coding Scheme. SMPP 3.4 introduced a new list of data_coding values (PDU body).

        SMPP v3.3

        The text message is encoded using Charset. According to that charset, the Data Coding Scheme is determined using the General Data Coding group table. Therefore, a simple mapping is applied:

        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM7 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_DEFAULT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_PACKED_GSM -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_DEFAULT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_8BIT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_8BIT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_UCS_2 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_UCS2

        SMPP v3.4+

        The text message is encoded using Charset. According to that charset, the Data Coding Scheme is determined using only the Alphabet table. Therefore, a simple mapping is applied:

        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM7 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_DEFAULT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_PACKED_GSM -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_DEFAULT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_8BIT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_8BIT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_ISO_8859_1 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_LATIN1
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_UCS_2 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_UCS2

        Behavior

        Standalone

        You can specify a direct value. For example: 

         .enable("true");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .enable("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.

        Custom DataCodingProvider also configured

        If a custom DataCodingProvider instance is registered, this instance is tried first (see custom(DataCodingProvider) for more information). The automatic behavior is applied after if returned value of custom DataCodingProvider is null.

        Fixed value also configured

        If a fixed value is configured then it preempts any other configuration ( auto(String...) and custom(DataCodingProvider) are not used at all).

        Parameters:
        enable - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • auto

        public DataCodingSchemeBuilder auto(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable automatic mode based on SMPP interface version.

        DataCodingProvider implementation is selected based on SMPP interface version. SMPP v3.3 Data Coding Scheme values are defined in SMS Data Coding Scheme. SMPP 3.4 introduced a new list of data_coding values (PDU body).

        SMPP v3.3

        The text message is encoded using Charset. According to that charset, the Data Coding Scheme is determined using the General Data Coding group table. Therefore, a simple mapping is applied:

        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM7 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_DEFAULT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_PACKED_GSM -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_DEFAULT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_8BIT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_8BIT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_UCS_2 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_UCS2

        SMPP v3.4+

        The text message is encoded using Charset. According to that charset, the Data Coding Scheme is determined using only the Alphabet table. Therefore, a simple mapping is applied:

        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM7 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_DEFAULT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_PACKED_GSM -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_DEFAULT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_8BIT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_8BIT
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_ISO_8859_1 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_LATIN1
        • CharsetUtil.NAME_UCS_2 -> DataCoding.CHAR_ENC_UCS2

        Behavior

        Standalone

        If several properties are already set using auto(String...), then the enabled value is appended. For example, 

         
 .auto("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .auto(true)
        If "custom.property.high-priority" property doesn't exist, then .auto(true) is used. If "custom.property.high-priority" property exists, then the value of "custom.property.high-priority" is used. 
         
 .auto(true)
 .auto("${custom.property.high-priority}")
        The value of .auto(true) is always used.

        Custom DataCodingProvider also configured

        If a custom DataCodingProvider instance is registered, this instance is tried first (see custom(DataCodingProvider) for more information). The automatic behavior is applied after if returned value of custom DataCodingProvider is null.

        Fixed value also configured

        If a fixed value is configured then it preempts any other configuration ( auto(String...) and custom(DataCodingProvider) are not used at all).

        Parameters:
        enable - enable (true) or disable (false) message splitting
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • value

        public DataCodingSchemeBuilder value(String... dataCoding)
        Use the same Data Coding Scheme value for all messages. You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .value((byte) 0x10);

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .value("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        dataCoding - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • value

        public DataCodingSchemeBuilder value(byte dataCoding)
        Use the same Data Coding Scheme value for all messages.

        If several properties are already set using value(String...), then the Data Coding Scheme value is appended. For example, 

          
 .value("${custom.property.high-priority}")
 .value((byte) 0x10)
        If "custom.property.high-priority" property doesn't exist, then .value((byte) 0x10) is used. If "custom.property.high-priority" property exists, then the value of "custom.property.high-priority" is used. 
          
 .value((byte) 0x10)
 .value("${custom.property.high-priority}")
        The value of .value((byte) 0x10) is always used.
        Parameters:
        dataCoding - the Data Coding Scheme value to use for all messages
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • custom

        public DataCodingSchemeBuilder custom(DataCodingProvider custom)
        Register a custom strategy to determine Data Coding Scheme value.

        Automatic behavior (see auto(String...) is still active but custom strategy is executed first. As the custom DataCodingProvider can return null, the automatic behavior is executed in that case.

        If null value is provided, custom strategy is disabled.

        Parameters:
        custom - the Strategy to determine Data Coding Scheme value.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • build

        public DataCodingProvider build()
        Description copied from interface: Builder
        Instantiate and configures the instance.
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<DataCodingProvider>
        Returns:
        The built instance
